articles.description: Pete Buttigieg will testify before a Senate panel on Thursday considering his nomination for transportation secretary, putting the former South Bend, Indiana, mayor on the path to becoming the first Senate-confirmed LGBTQ Cabinet secretary.

articles.author: Sara Spary, CNN
articles.title: 'Significant' cannabis factory found near the Bank of England
articles.description: City of London Police have discovered and destroyed a "significant" cannabis factory in the heart of London following reports about the strong smell of the plant.

articles.author: Richard Parr and Don Riddell, CNN
articles.title: Conor McGregor is one of the best at 'getting under your skin,' says Dustin Poirier
articles.description: Conor McGregor is back. Again. The 'Notorious' UFC fighter returns to the Octagon after a third retirement this Saturday and his UFC 257 opponent Dustin Poirier is pleased not many fans will be able to attend.

articles.author: Matias Grez, CNN
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo's 760th goal fuels debate over greatest goalscorer of all time
articles.description: Cristiano Ronaldo's goal in Juventus' Italian Super Cup win over Napoli on Wednesday took his career scoring tally to 760, making him the highest goalscorer of all time -- or is he?

articles.author: MJ Lee, CNN
articles.title: Biden is inheriting a nonexistent Covid-19 vaccine plan from Trump administration, sources say
articles.description: Newly sworn in President Joe Biden and his advisers are inheriting no coronavirus vaccine distribution plan to speak of from the Trump administration, sources tell CNN, posing a significant challenge for the new White House.

articles.author: Katie Lobosco, CNN
articles.title: Biden pushes to reopen schools within 100 days
articles.description: President Joe Biden is pledging to reopen most K-12 schools within 100 days -- an ambitious goal as Covid cases surge and teachers across the country fight some plans to reopen.

articles.title: Late-night hosts react to Biden's inauguration
articles.description: Late-night hosts Jimmy Fallon, Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Kimmel, Seth Meyers, James Corden, Samantha Bee and Trevor Noah joke about President Joe Biden's inauguration and Donald Trump's farewell.

articles.author: By Miquel Ros, CNN
articles.title: Europe's Star Cities, marvels of Renaissance engineering
articles.description: Built in the 16th and 17th centuries, Europe's geometrically perfect "star cities" were engineered by some of the most brilliant minds of their time, but their wonders can only be truly appreciated from the air
articles.content:
(CNN) They're scattered all over Europe but their perfect geometrical beauty can only be fully admired when seen from above.

articles.title: He bonded with Biden over stutter. Then got the call to speak at inauguration
articles.description: Brayden Harrington, the 13-year-old boy who bonded with then President-elect Joe Biden over their shared experience with stuttering, tells CNN's Chris Cuomo and Don Lemon about speaking at the inauguration.

articles.author: Analysis by Jill Disis, CNN Business
articles.title: The China trade war is one thing Joe Biden won't be rushing to fix
articles.description: US President Joe Biden is inheriting a tense and messy relationship with China from his predecessor.

articles.author: Joe Sutton, CNN
articles.title: There was one winning ticket in $730 million Powerball lottery
articles.description: There is a winner to the historic Powerball lottery this morning, worth $731.1 million.
articles.content:

articles.author: Aqeel Najm, Jomana Karadsheh, Kareem Khadder and Tamara Qiblawi, CNN
articles.title: At least 13 killed as twin suicide bombings rock Baghdad
articles.description: Twin suicide bombs rocked a busy market in central Baghdad on Thursday morning, killing at least 13 people, a security official told CNN.

articles.title: Harris' Indian uncle reacts to her historic moment
articles.description: CNN's Vedika Sud reports from New Delhi on the pride and celebrations in India for Kamala Harris' inauguration as the first female, first Black and first South Asian Vice President of the United States.

articles.author: Michelle L.D. Hanlon, University of Mississippi
articles.title: Astronaut artifacts on moon -- like Apollo landers and Neil Armstrong's bootprint -- now protected by US law
articles.description: Who cares what happens to astronaut artifacts on the moon? All humans should. The US One Small Step Act is the first law enacted by any nation that recognizes the existence of human heritage in outer space.

articles.author: Terry Ward, CNN
articles.title: Loss of smell drives Covid-19 survivors to get creative in the kitchen
articles.description: A loss of smell — or anosmia — is a common symptom of Covid-19, and it can severely impact people's ability to taste. People still need to eat, of course, and they're modifying their meals as a result.
articles.content:
(CNN)Emergency physician Dr. Alex Yeats had just whipped up what seemed like an appetizing dinner option when his wife let him know she wasn't having anything to do with it.

articles.title: Couples struggle with sleep problems in the Covid-19 pandemic
articles.description: Couples are having to spend more time together under enormously stressful circumstances during the coronavirus pandemic, and it's affecting their ability to get enough sleep.
articles.content:
(CNN)Dave Russell is a light sleeper, but he never had any issues sharing a bed with his girlfriend, Izzy James, before the pandemic.
